channel.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
channel.description: Can someone please help me make my Laptop run faster then it is? i got it last July 28 2007.. its a dell vista, inspiron

Oh and i am not a microsoft whore.

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @vbcoderx vbcoderx
item.description:
@vbcoderx wrote:

those people who are supporting vista are just microsoft whores… why is it… that a computer that was made for vista/ came with vista, when xp is installed, boot up twice or more times faster than vista? why has everyone been calling windows vista, windows ME 2? because ME sucked, microsoft apologized for windows me… and whats the point of upgrading to vista? more money for microsoft, plus more versions of the OS means even more money… the new product licensing screws more legitimate users over. Meaning more money… and idk if this is true or not, but im getting reports of ms logging what users browse in IE7…

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:16, topic:158723”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=216277.msg1886913#msg1886913 date=1195509017]

[quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=216277.msg1886778#msg1886778 date=1195487964]

Nice conversation, not sure how any of this is helping the OP though. :P[/quote]

The only thing OP can do is get more ram. No program will miraculously make his laptop faster than it is now, unless he has some SERIOUS problems with it.

Considering he bought it from Dell,[/quote]

My laptop is a Dell, and it has NEVER lagged bad.[/quote]
Seriosuly i don’t know why people say dells suck… Ive had a dell since the diablo days and had no problem with them. But i bought many diffrent ones depending on the games i would be playing. Like I use my dell inspiron 1200 just for xbox live only and then i got me a dell insiron 1501 to play css cod 2 (UO) and 4.

And yea like javac said dells come with norton and bunch of bull crap you don’t need , uninstall that and that will make startup little bit faster.

And which dell do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:14, topic:158723”][quote author=Schizzo link=topic=216277.msg1885980#msg1885980 date=1195441333]
Nice conversation, not sure how any of this is helping the OP though. :P[/quote]

The only thing OP can do is get more ram. No program will miraculously make his laptop faster than it is now, unless he has some SERIOUS problems with it.[/quote]

Considering he bought it from Dell, it probably still has AOL, Norton, Java, Reaplayer, etc still installed on it. Any program that just deleted all his autostarts would make it faster.

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

The Un-Named:

Exactly, that’s what I mean, unless Vista calculates how much you use averagely and reserves a little more than that, it should either reserve it all or do it the XP way.

But why not just reserve half, and then use more when/if it’s needed

Read full topic

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Nice conversation, not sure how any of this is helping the OP though.

Anyway, you can go to www.tweakvista.com and look there. They’ll definitely have some things there to help speed it up. Be careful though.

Read full topic

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:9, topic:158723”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=216277.msg1885503#msg1885503 date=1195420137]

mrrules, you do realise that Vista is almost ‘storing’ that RAM, so that as soon as you click on an application it will load up much faster than on XP. It’s also useful to have it stored for other things.

My Vista took up 50% of my RAM (900mb), but it was super fast to run. The only problem I had with it were some games and programs I wanted to use refused to.

Seriously, why the hell would it need to reserve 900mb ram? Why not just take it all?
[/quote]

Because it doesn’t need it all. If anything, it’s probably over storing RAM.[/quote]

Exactly, that’s what I mean, unless Vista calculates how much you use averagely and reserves a little more than that, it should either reserve it all or do it the XP way.

Read full topic

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @ladylumps69 ladylumps69
item.description:
@ladylumps69 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:8, topic:158723”][quote author=Mr.Chris link=topic=216277.msg1885303#msg1885303 date=1195404236]
mrrules, you do realise that Vista is almost ‘storing’ that RAM, so that as soon as you click on an application it will load up much faster than on XP. It’s also useful to have it stored for other things.

My Vista took up 50% of my RAM (900mb), but it was super fast to run. The only problem I had with it were some games and programs I wanted to use refused to.
[/quote]

Seriously, why the hell would it need to reserve 900mb ram? Why not just take it all?[/quote]

Because if it pre-loads all your commonly used programs into memory they will load a hell of a lot faster than if it was loading them from the hard drive. It’s actually quite a clever feature although could do with a few tweaks

Read full topic

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?

item.description:

mrrules, you do realise that Vista is almost ‘storing’ that RAM, so that as soon as you click on an application it will load up much faster than on XP. It’s also useful to have it stored for other things.

My Vista took up 50% of my RAM (900mb), but it was super fast to run. The only problem I had with it were some games and programs I wanted to use refused to.
[/quote]

Seriously, why the hell would it need to reserve 900mb ram? Why not just take it all?[/quote]

Because it doesn’t need it all. If anything, it’s probably over storing RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @mrrules mrrules
item.description:
@mrrules wrote:

LOL AT VISTA!

Sorry I laugh at my sister about that too…

yea vista is a nono!

vista ate 600 mb of ram from my sis computer and its slow a bitch!

First get xp home/pro and if you can’t do that just buy more ram so it might run alittle bit faster.

What inprion do you have? me and sis have the 1501 but mine runs faster then her’s cause she has vista so that will make a big diffrence.

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @Songoty Songoty
item.description:
@Songoty wrote:

De-fragment your HD
Remove ANY programs you do not use
you dont need more then one of the same thing like 5 different video players
Clean your Registry

Read full topic

item.title: Making My Laptop run Faster?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Open up task manager and end of processes that are not needed, then find what uses them processes and uninstall that program.
Won’t make a lot of difference but should make a bit.

Read full topic
